title: [$500]  Room - User mention in the system message after inviting member to the room cannot be copied

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

comments.body: Triggered auto assignment to @stephanieelliott (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync

:wave: Friendly reminder that deploy blockers are time-sensitive ⏱ issues! [Check out the open `StagingDeployCash` deploy checklist](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AStagingDeployCash) to see the list of PRs included in this release, then work quickly to do one of the following:
  1. Identify the pull request that introduced this issue and revert it.
  2. Find someone who can quickly fix the issue.
  3. Fix the issue yourself.
Triggered auto assignment to @cead22 (`Engineering`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4319 for more details.
Looks like the report `INVITETOROOM` report action's `html` message is in the format `invited ` and it might need to be `invited person@domain.com`. Going to check when/where we added this.

cc @jasperhuangg I see recent changes to InviteToRoom in https://github.com/Expensify/Auth/pull/8776/, do you have an idea if it's related?

Anyway you can still triple-click + Command+C on the message, and it will copy everything including the invitee's email address, so I don't know if this is worth being a blocker.
If it's on staging and not production, it can't be due to an Auth change right?
Could be if staging uses a brand new API + Auth command, but InviteToRoom is not a new command so yeah it's probably not that :/

Hmmm these are accountID-based mentions, which should only include the accountID. I double-checked with @puneetlath when I created these API commands that these would be sufficient, but it seems like our copy-paste functionality hasn't been updated to account for these new types of mentions
(Discussing in Slack here https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07J32337/p1697741788107389)
Job added to Upwork: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~018b64b832924292d8
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @ArekChr (`External`)
Deemed NAB: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07J32337/p1697741788107389
Current assignee @stephanieelliott is eligible for the NewFeature assigner, not assigning anyone new.
cc @samh-nl - looks like you worked on accountID-based mentions in https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/26877. Feel free to chime in if you have any insight on this issue.

Interesting, one solution would be to add a condition to match user mentions and return the display name [here](https://github.com/Expensify/expensify-common/blob/6517be47d31aef07b15c90fdf347a341f3b9b58d/lib/ExpensiMark.js#L388). Possibly also add a similar processing step to `htmlToMarkdownRules`.

A different way is to add a more general pre-processing step that fills in the display name. Perhaps then the logic for this in `MentionUserRenderer` can be made redundant.

Not directly related to this issue with copying, but there is also `message.text` that is lacking the name and this sounds like it would need a BE fix.

## Proposal

### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
User mention in the system message is not copied. This is because the logic that's called when we click the "Copy" button hasn't been updated to handle accountID based mentions. It only handles login-based mentions.

### What is the root cause of that problem?
We're not handling copying for accountID-based mention like `<muted-text>invited <mention-user accountID=XXX></mention-user></muted-text>`, so when we copy it, it cannot be parsed properly to text or markdown so it just shows whitespace for the mention part.

### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
<!-- DO NOT POST CODE DIFFS -->
1. In `htmlToText` [here](https://github.com/Expensify/expensify-common/blob/6517be47d31aef07b15c90fdf347a341f3b9b58d/lib/ExpensiMark.js#L653) add a `personalDetails` params and pass it in when we're using `htmlToText`, can have `{}` as the default value
2. In [here](https://github.com/Expensify/expensify-common/blob/6517be47d31aef07b15c90fdf347a341f3b9b58d/lib/ExpensiMark.js#L384), add a rule for `mention-user` tag, we'll extract the accountID from this tag (if exists), find the corresponding login or display name similar to [this logic](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/fcee2073f096ad60dd9f30c536342de7d3893282/src/components/HTMLEngineProvider/HTMLRenderers/MentionUserRenderer.js#L43), and insert it as `@${loginOrDisplayName}` inside the `mention-user` tag. In order to do this, we'll have to add a `getReplacementFn(personalDetails)` method to return the replacement function for usage in the `htmlToText`, so that we can inject the  `personalDetails` data in the rules
3. Do step 1-2 similarly for the `htmlToMarkdown`
4. When the above copied message is pasted, and sent as a new message, we can optionally inject the accountID (by getting it via login, from personalDetails) back inside the `mention-user` [here](https://github.com/Expensify/expensify-common/blob/6517be47d31aef07b15c90fdf347a341f3b9b58d/lib/ExpensiMark.js#L123), so if the primary login/display name/visibility status of the mentioned user changes, it will follow the correct display logic for mention in [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/fcee2073f096ad60dd9f30c536342de7d3893282/src/components/HTMLEngineProvider/HTMLRenderers/MentionUserRenderer.js#L43)

### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
NA

<!---
ATTN: Contributor+

You are the first line of defense in making sure every proposal has a clear and easily understood problem with a "root cause". Do not approve any proposals that lack a satisfying explanation to the first two prompts. It is CRITICALLY important that we understand the root cause at a minimum even if the solution doesn't directly address it. When we avoid this step we can end up solving the wrong problems entirely or just writing hacks and workarounds.

Instructions for how to review a proposal:

1. Address each contributor proposal one at a time and address each part of the question one at a time e.g. if a solution looks acceptable, but the stated problem is not clear then you should provide feedback and make suggestions to improve each prompt before moving on to the next. Avoid responding to all sections of a proposal at once. Move from one question to the next each time asking the contributor to "Please update your original proposal and tag me again when it's ready for review".

2. Limit excessive conversation and moderate issues to keep them on track. If someone is doing any of the following things please kindly and humbly course-correct them:

- Posting PRs.
- Posting large multi-line diffs (this is basically a PR).
- Skipping any of the required questions.
- Not using the proposal template at all.
- Suggesting that an existing issue is related to the current issue before a problem or root cause has been established.
- Excessively wordy explanations.

3. Choose the first proposal that has a reasonable answer to all the required questions.
-->
@cead22, @ArekChr, @stephanieelliott Whoops! This issue is 2 days overdue. Let's get this updated quick!
@tienifr Is it possible to just copy the displayed value? While pasting it, the dropdown with the user will work as well.
📣 It's been a week! Do we have any satisfactory proposals yet? Do we need to adjust the bounty for this issue? 💸

> @tienifr Is it possible to just copy the displayed value?

@ArekChr  I don't think it's possible, the displayed value is rendered using the `MentionUserRenderer`, which only has knowledge of its own `accountid` prop, not other parts of the text, while we're copying from the reportAction message `html`. So I think parsing it from the html is our best choice.

@tienifr Thanks for the explanation. After reviewing the [proposal](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/29978#issuecomment-1773692177) I’m confident it’s a solid plan of action.

:ribbon: :eyes: :ribbon: C+ Reviewed
Current assignee @cead22 is eligible for the choreEngineerContributorManagement assigner, not assigning anyone new.

Thanks @ArekChr @tienifr. Is it a bit odd to be passing personal details to the Expensimark, which should only know about converting plain text to html and vice versa. If so, are there any alternative approaches?

@jasperhuangg @puneetlath mind giving this proposal a look and confirming it looks good to you since you're familiar with mentions and this issue? Thanks
@cead22 @tienifr I think passing only the `accountID` value should be enough.

I agree it is a bit weird. The MentionUserRenderer is rendering a `Text` element which has the actual text that is being displayed, right? Is there any way to pass that instead of the `Mention-User` element? Or I guess we currently just pull whatever the html is in the `message` field of the reportAction? 

Hmm, it's a tricky one.

@cead22 @ArekChr @stephanieelliott this issue was created 2 weeks ago. Are we close to approving a proposal? If not, what's blocking us from getting this issue assigned? Don't hesitate to create a thread in #expensify-open-source to align faster in real time. Thanks!
📣 It's been a week! Do we have any satisfactory proposals yet? Do we need to adjust the bounty for this issue? 💸

@puneetlath Are you suggesting this

> Is there any way to pass that instead of the Mention-User element? Or I guess we currently just pull whatever the html is in the message field of the reportAction?

over just grabbing the accountID from the mention and looking up the text that we're supposed to display again to avoid doing duplicate work? That seems like the approach that's being suggested in @tienifr's [proposal](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/29978#issuecomment-1773692177), which I'm currently fine with.

I feel like we could refactor whatever logic we're using to display the mention into a utility function that we can reuse in this situation. Thoughts?
@cead22, @ArekChr, @stephanieelliott Whoops! This issue is 2 days overdue. Let's get this updated quick!
Started a slack thread in open source to better understand this issue and get aligned on the fix
Triggered auto assignment to @MitchExpensify (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.

    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead

    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.

Reapplying the `Bug` label to get another BZ member on this while I am OOO til Nov 13. Thanks @MitchExpensify   I'll grab this back from you when I return!

@cead22 @ArekChr @stephanieelliott @MitchExpensify this issue is now 3 weeks old. There is one more week left before this issue breaks WAQ and will need to go internal. What needs to happen to get a PR in review this week? Please create a thread in #expensify-open-source to discuss. Thanks!
📣 It's been a week! Do we have any satisfactory proposals yet? Do we need to adjust the bounty for this issue? 💸

https://github.com/Expensify/expensify-common/pull/600 The PR fix expensify-common is up @ArekChr
@cead22 @stephanieelliott  [The PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/30898) already fixed this issue. I just closed [my PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31169).

Thanks @tienifr! Per [this internal SO](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/8719), we'll pay out as normal for this PR and review.

Summarizing payment on this issue:

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.3.87-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No, new feature **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team **Slack conversation:** ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create a room 3. Click on the room header > Members > Invite > Invite anyone to the room 4. Right click on the system invitation message > Copy to clipboard 5. Paste the message in the composer ## Expected Result: The system message along with the user mention will be copied ## Actual Result: User mention in the system message is not copied. This is because the logic that's called when we click the "Copy" button hasn't been updated to handle accountID based mentions. It only handles login-based mentions. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [x] Android: Native - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: Native - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos
Android: Native
Android: mWeb Chrome
iOS: Native
iOS: mWeb Safari
MacOS: Chrome / Safari https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/78819774/7b7c4c11-a768-4886-b359-1e1909cbc4d4
MacOS: Desktop
